body:
I spent tens of thousands of dollars to build my ultimate man cave. The back wall of the band room/recording studio is a giant bookcase full of books and European board games. You push a particular game and a section swings out to reveal a bed facing a 65" 4K television bolted to the ceiling. HDMI cables run through the wall into the utility room next door, which houses a gaming PC, PS4, three legacy consoles, and a mini-fridge full of beer.

It's pretty fucking great.

body:
Thing is, I *don't* own the whole fucking house. It was purchased mostly with my wife's money, on my girlfriend's credit. My main contribution was hundreds of hours of backbreaking labor. I put in like $50K, but they're each putting in more than a quarter-mil.

We've gotten it basically divided into four wings. 

The upper floor is my wife's domain - nice and classy and suited for a faculty salon with expensive cocktails.

The back corner is my son's. Trampolines and bunk beds and octopus art everywhere. He's obsessed with water.

The front corner is my girlfriend's. It's full of creepy dolls and bird skulls and shrines to dead pets and about a hundred houseplants.

And then I get the recording studio, band room, gaming room. And yeah, it's pretty cave-like. I love me a good cave.

body:
I went on a seven day fresh juice fast.  

Lost the little beer belly I'd been working on the several years, stopped drinking and dipping tobacco, started working out as well.  

Doing that week fast was like a domino effect of healthy choices for me- I am much less of a procrastinator now and more deliberate in the activities I allow myself to do or refuse to.

parent.body:
Thing is, I *don't* own the whole fucking house. It was purchased mostly with my wife's money, on my girlfriend's credit. My main contribution was hundreds of hours of backbreaking labor. I put in like $50K, but they're each putting in more than a quarter-mil.

We've gotten it basically divided into four wings. 

The upper floor is my wife's domain - nice and classy and suited for a faculty salon with expensive cocktails.

The back corner is my son's. Trampolines and bunk beds and octopus art everywhere. He's obsessed with water.

The front corner is my girlfriend's. It's full of creepy dolls and bird skulls and shrines to dead pets and about a hundred houseplants.

And then I get the recording studio, band room, gaming room. And yeah, it's pretty cave-like. I love me a good cave.

post.title: What in your life is going really well right now?

body: I can't really complain overall.  But I had a gut punch of a February, which made me realize I am giving too much of me to others and not keeping enough for me.  Because of this, I took the initiative to do a few big things for me too, going forward into the year ahead.  I feel a little guilty about it still, but I have the full support of my spouse (who has been pretty much telling me to take some time for myself for a while now too).  Just kinda wish it didn't have to involve handcuffing and an ER visit to realize this... sigh (had a work stress and dehydration induced seizure).

parent.body:
I spent tens of thousands of dollars to build my ultimate man cave. The back wall of the band room/recording studio is a giant bookcase full of books and European board games. You push a particular game and a section swings out to reveal a bed facing a 65" 4K television bolted to the ceiling. HDMI cables run through the wall into the utility room next door, which houses a gaming PC, PS4, three legacy consoles, and a mini-fridge full of beer.

It's pretty fucking great.
